speaker: Frasier
text: Tricia...I am so very sorry.  Have you been waiting long?

speaker: Tricia
text: Well, let's see:  we were supposed to meet at noon and it's now quarter to one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I do apologize, it's just that the most extraordinary thing happened.

speaker: Tricia
text: Well, at least I'll get a colorful anecdote out of this. What was it?

speaker: Frasier
text: My watch stopped.

speaker: Tricia
text: [_rising_] I gotta go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no.  That really is extraordinary.  You see, it's a very fine Swiss timepiece, it only loses a minute per decade.

speaker: Tricia
text: And you've had it for what?  Four hundred and fifty years? I'm sorry Frasier, I have an appointment at one.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, please, please, let me have another chance. I so enjoyed meeting you last night, I'd love to get to know you better.

speaker: Tricia
text: Well, I suppose even Swiss watches sometimes stop.

speaker: Frasier
text: You'd be amazed how much fondue gets overcooked that way. [_They laugh._] Listen, how about lunch tomorrow?  I know the maitre d' over at the Le Petite Bistro, he'll give us the best table in the house.  Please?

speaker: Tricia
text: Well, OK.  I'll meet you there at one.  That's when the little hand is on the one...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, I know,  I know. [_as she leaves_] See you then.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank god you have room.  I just spent ten stupefying minutes sharing a table with a taxidermist.  I swear, he doesn't have to stuff his trophies, he can just bore them stiff.  Who was that woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, a young woman I met during intermission at the opera last night.  I swear, Niles, it was remarkable. Our hands touched, there was a spark.  After ten minutes of conversation, I knew I had to know this young woman better.  Ever experience that sort of thing?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, yes, I do know a thing or two about the spark of attraction.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Oh, excuse me, may I have non-fat cappuccino, please?  Well, what am I to deduce, that you've recently gotten lucky?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  And here's the kicker: she lives in your building. Five floors down, Allison Landis.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you little sneak.  I don't even know the woman. How did you two meet?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we were just chatting on the elevator.  I walked her to her car, where it turned out she'd locked her keys inside.  My resourcefulness saved the day...

speaker: Frasier
text: What'd you do, fish them out with a coat hanger?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I called the auto club.  Where would I find a coat hanger?  Anyway, she invited me to join her for lunch, we hit it off.  The next night, I took her to dinner, one thing led to another, and soon, there was no need for words.

speaker: Frasier
text: Except for your frantically babbled "Thank you's."

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well.  I'm seeing her again tonight, so you'll understand if I'm a little bit drained during our squash game.  My lovemaking can get slightly athletic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Which is more than can be said for your squash game.

speaker: Niles
text: It's funny - I've been away from the seduction scene so long I was worried I had started to lose my technique? Were those fears ever groundless.  You know, it's like French, you can go without speaking it for years, then just a few hours on the old _boulevarde d'amour_ and you, ah... [_Frasier rises._] Where are you going?

speaker: Frasier
text: To sit with the taxidermist.  _FADE OUT  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Frasier and Niles come in, wearing athletic clothes._

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe this has happened to me two days in a row!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you had car trouble, it can happen to anyone.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope she's still sitting at Le Petite Bistro.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, she isn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: If you're talking about someone named Tricia, she called To say she was leaving the restaurant.  She also said you were right about the table: that it was a beautiful table in a prime location, and that she wished you were laid out dead on top of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dialing_] Oh, God.  Ah, it's her machine.  Hello, Tricia, it's Frasier.  Look, I'm, I'm terribly sorry but it's just my car battery went dead at a light, and I didn't have my cell phone with me.  By the time I got a jump I realized I couldn't go directly to the restaurant because I was wearing these ridiculous shorts, and I, I know how this sounds, but it's the truth!  Here, just ask my brother. [_He holds the phone out to Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: He's right, they're ridiculous shorts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, please give me one more chance.  I'll go anywhere, anytime, just, uh, give me a call.  Please. [_he disconnects_]

speaker: Niles
text: May I have the phone?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_handing it over_] Of course.  God, I had such high hopes for this young woman, now I've gone and blown it twice. Whom are you calling?

speaker: Niles
text: [_dialing_] Allison.  It's been hours since we spoke. [_into the phone, in a risqu e voice_] Hello, there. How ya feeling?  Uh-huh.  Me too. [_holding his back_] Yeah, me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing him_] Oh for God's sake, take it in my bedroom! You're makin' the dog twitch!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, you're gonna be so excited when you hear what I got planned for your birthday!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, please, I thought I said I didn't want any fuss this year.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, get ready to change your mind, 'cause I scored tickets, Friday night, to the best show in town. [_He takes two tickets out of his pocket and holds them up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Chimps on Ice?  Oh, my.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, now I know this doesn't sound like your cup of tea, but trust me on this.  Duke saw this last week and he busted a gut.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: [_grabbing his coat_] And mind you, he even saw it with the understudy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, look, you know, I really don't feel like going out on my birthday this year.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I actually had made plans already.  I was gonna stay in and watch television.  The opera is mounting a new production of _"Cosi van Tutti."_

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well no wonder then.  OK, but you're missing a real treat.  Duke said in the finale, the whole cast skates to the top of this ramp, then Splat! right into a tank of whipped cream.  Bet they don't do that at your opera.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  And Mozart's still kicking himself.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, boy. [_He leaves with Eddie._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming back_] Frasier?  Are you familiar with the Safari Club?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course I'm familiar with them.  Their yearly expeditions are remarkable.

speaker: Niles
text: They're more than remarkable!  They're the stuff of legend. Last year, they made camp at the base of Mount Everest, then had their servants climb it while they held a wine tasting.

speaker: Frasier
text: So why are you telling me this?

speaker: Niles
text: Because, Allison is a member.  This Friday night, they're having a black tie reception at her place downstairs, and we're invited!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's incredible!  Oh my goodness!

speaker: Niles
text: Consider it your birthday present.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you!  Thank you so much.  But wait, gee, I told Dad I was gonna stay home that night.  You mustn't tell him about this.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't worry.  He'll never suspect.  I told him yesterday I was going to be away for the weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.  Perfect.  But wait a minute: you knew about this yesterday?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, no.  But I knew about Chimps on Ice.  **HAVE YOU TRIED THE CAPE BUFFALO SALAD?** _Scene 3 - The Fourteenth Floor Hallway Fade in.  Niles and Frasier exit the elevator in tuxedos._

speaker: Niles
text: I am so looking forward to this.  I understand one of the members is going to show an old film he made of the rare and endangered species found only in the rain forest. Maris would have loved it. [_He rings the doorbell._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, why so?

speaker: Niles
text: She had shoes made from almost all of them.

speaker: Niles
text: Allison. [_He hugs her._]

speaker: Allison
text: Niles.  And this must be Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Allison
text: Come in, both of you.  There are lots of people I'd like you to meet. _CUT TO: the interior of her apartment.  A lavish banquet is set out._

speaker: Allison
text: The bar is over there, and the hors d'oeuvres are over here.  We have some fascinating delicacies actually bagged by our own members.  This is ostrich, that's wildebeest, and that's springbok.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I can never remember which... Is it "Fall ahead, Springbok" or vice versa? [_They laugh, Frasier's cell phone starts ringing._] Oh, oh good heavens, I forgot I had this on me.

speaker: Allison
text: Don't apologize.  I do it myself.  Even in the veldt, one must keep in touch with one's broker.  Here, you can have privacy in the study.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_moving off_] Thank you.  Hello?

speaker: Niles
text: You look ravishing.

speaker: Allison
text: Thank you, but listen, I think you and I should be very discreet tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm a psychiatrist.  If I can't be discreet, it don't rain in Tanganyika.  [_N.B. Modern-day Tanzania_]

speaker: Allison
text: Good.  After all, if in the near future you should happen to be up for membership in our little club, I want to appear completely objective when I sing your praises.

speaker: Niles
text: My ears are already burning.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  We're being considered for membership.  Allison as much as said it.  We must do everything in our power to show them how enthusiastic we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have to leave.

speaker: Niles
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that was Tricia on the phone.  She's going out of town tonight for a month.  But if I swing by, pick her up at her place, pick her up, we can at least join each other for a drink.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you insane?  This is the Safari Club.  These are the people who introduced badminton to Devil's Island.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't care!  It was kismet when I met this young woman, I'm not giving up an opportunity to see her!

speaker: Niles
text: But, to leave two minutes after you arrived, you're going to ruin both our chances!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'll make a proper excuse.  Excuse me, Allison? I'm terribly sorry, it seems I'm coming down with a touch of something, I'm going to have to leave.

speaker: Allison
text: You poor man.  If you feel better, please do come back down.  We'll be here all evening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, but I, I don't really see that there's much hope. _He leaves.  CUT TO: the hallway outside Frasier's apartment. The elevator opens._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm just stopping by my place to pick up my keys, I will see you in ten minutes.  And Tricia?  I can't wait.  OK, bye. _He goes into the apartment, grabs his keys, and suddenly the lights come up on a crowd._

speaker: Crowd
text: Surprise!  _Frasier is stunned.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in on the same scene._

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't think we were gonna let you stay home alone on your birthday, did ya?  Look at his face!  He can't believe it.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I certainly can't.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, why are you dressed like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I, I dress like this sometimes when I watch the opera on television.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, that's up there on the dork meter.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, since I'm not going to be watching the opera, perhaps I could run out and buy a brand new videotape so I can record it.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're way ahead of you, Dr. Crane, your father has the VCR all set up.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Let's get things started!  Here you go, Doc.  Happy birthday. [_Hands him a brown bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening it_] Oh, well, thank you Bulldog, thank you all. Oh, well, "David Copperfield," Dickens's classic tale of a young man making his way in the world.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I, uh, think we're talking about different movies, here, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking again_] Mmm.  "David Cop-a-Feel."  Well...

speaker: Bulldog
text: But you were right about the classy tail part.  Hey, you need a brew?  I'm headed that way.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no thanks.

speaker: Roz
text: I'd love a cup of hot tea with lemon.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, I'm fetching, not cooking.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's OK, Roz.  There's a kettle of boiling water on the stove. [_She gives a cup to Frasier_] Here you are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Now don't be mad with your father.  He just wanted to do something nice for your birthday, after you turned thumbs down on the skating monkeys.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, great party huh?  Just as long as we've got enough ice.  You got four bags, right?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I got two.

speaker: Martin
text: Two?!  I told you to get four bags!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, here we go.

speaker: Martin
text: You never under-budget on the ice.  You never know, you might get a lot more rocks drinkers than you expected. Or ice chewers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I can go get some more ice!

speaker: Daphne
text: We don't need more ice!  We've got plenty.  There's a whole tub of it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, then, excuse me.  I need to make a call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tricia, Frasier.  Look, I've been detained.  Yes, I know you really don't want to know why.  Say, you know what? I think I can find a way to get out of here.  Yes, I'll see you in a few minutes. _He pours the kettle out into the ice bowl, and calls out to the living room._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.  Bad news, seems your ice is melting awfully fast.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_heading for the door_] No worries, I'll get some more.

speaker: Roz
text: [_racing ahead of him_] No, Frasier, it's your party, I'll go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, I want to go.

speaker: Roz
text: But you just got here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, it's my birthday, I can do whatever I want on my birthday, I want to go get some ice.

speaker: Martin
text: [_hollering from the kitchen_] I knew it!  I warned her! It's practically gone!

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, Dad!  I'm on it!

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, I'll be glad to go...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I want to go, I know what kind Dad likes! _He throws her against the powder room door, and rushes out.  FADE OUT  Scene 2 - The Elevator Fade in.  Frasier is watching the buttons._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, don't stop on fourteen.  Just don't stop on fourteen.  No, no!

speaker: Allison
text: Frasier!  I'm delighted you're feeling better.  You're just in time, we're about to start the film.  Wait 'til you see it. [_She escorts him inside._] Just grab a chair before all the good seats are gone.

speaker: Niles
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Wishing I had taken the stairs.

speaker: Karl
text: If I wanted this martini shaken, I'd have asked the bartender to do it.

speaker: Nigel
text: Mustn't mind old Rhino, always in a vile mood.

speaker: Frasier
text: "Rhino?"

speaker: Nigel
text: Karl Landis, Allison's husband.  They call him "Rhino" because of his mean temper.

speaker: Niles
text: [_lightly_] Husband?  Allison's m-married?

speaker: Nigel
text: Not surprised people don't know.  Man's always on safari. Loves guns.  Guns and women.  No secret, notorious for it.  Cheats on her constantly.  Mark my words, one of these days she'll pay him back and then rub his bloodthirsty nose in it.

speaker: Niles
text: Here's something interesting: I think I just swallowed my tongue. [_starts hyperventilating_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, just be calm, be calm.  What's done is done.  You didn't know, and now it's over.  As long as you've both been discreet, there's no reason it should ever get back to Rhino.

speaker: Karl
text: [_as the whole room falls silent_] I don't know what you're insinuating.

speaker: Allison
text: Well, don't lie.  Everyone knows what goes on in that pup tent.  Well, I can play at that game too.  In fact, I already have, and with somebody right here tonight. How do you like that?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I have to ask a small favor.  I need you to create a distraction, while I have a sex change and move to Europe.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Niles, I would love to stay and help, but I've got to get out of here myself.

speaker: Allison
text: Well, we're ready for the movie.  Mind helping me turn out the lights?

speaker: Frasier
text: Splendid idea!  You're going to want it nice and dark in here, aren't you?

speaker: Niles
text: You should have told me you were married.  I have to leave.

speaker: Allison
text: Don't be a fool.  If he sees someone sneaking out of here, that's the first person he'll suspect.

speaker: Frasier
text: All set, and it's show time.  _The film starts, Frasier sneaks on his hands and knees behind everybody.  Suddenly the projector stops.  The lights come up._

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Allison
text: Did someone pull the plug out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yep.  Here it is!  All right, lights out.  There you go. _The film starts up again, the lights go out.  Frasier sneaks out the door.  At the sound of it closing, the movies stops and the lights come up again._

speaker: Karl
text: What was that?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, someone certainly snuck out of here in a hurry.

speaker: Karl
text: I know what you're all thinking.  Now that Allison has seen fit to air our dirty laundry in public, you assume that was her lover.  But I know it wasn't.

speaker: Niles
text: How?

speaker: Karl
text: Because I can sense that he's still here.  In the jungle, I learned to smell fear, and I smell it now.

speaker: Karl
text: So, let's see if the swine has the guts to stand up and admit it before I expose him.  What about it, coward? Going to stand up? _Niles looks nervous, then steels himself, puts his hand on the back of the chair, and starts to rise.  Before he can, about half a dozen others of varying age stand up.  Niles eases back down._

speaker: Karl
text: That many? [_to Allison_] My God, woman, you're as bad as I am.  Come on, ya bastards, join me in a drink. _The all go off to another room as Niles laughs nervously and sips his drink.  FADE TO:  Scene 3 - the hallway. The elevator opens and Frasier gets on, there are a few people from the station on it, including Noel._

speaker: Noel
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.  We're all just on our way up to your place.

speaker: Frasier
text: Noel.  So you are.  Hi Tom, Janet, Bill.  You know what? I was just heading down, we're out of ice.

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, not anymore.  I brought a twenty-pound bag.  Just call me Noel Shempsky, Party Saver. _CUT TO: Frasier's apartment.  Everyone is playing charades as Frasier and the others come in._

speaker: Roz
text: Time!

speaker: Frasier
text: Here's the ice!  Here, Noel, put that in the kitchen, will you?

speaker: Noel
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on in, everybody.  You know, Dad, I've done the silliest thing.  I went out without my wallet.  They gave me the ice, but I have to go back and pay them.

speaker: Roz
text: No, at least stay and play the last round of charades with us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, I should be getting back there...

speaker: Daphne
text: You love [_pronounced charhade:_]charades.

speaker: Martin
text: [_pronounced as spelt_] Charades.

speaker: Daphne
text: Shut up.  Anyway, it's not going to kill them, to wait a few minutes for their money.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come on, be on our team.  We really suck at this game.

speaker: Roz
text: Noel, you're on our team.  The category is famous play titles. [_She takes a slip._]

speaker: Noel
text: I'm a bear at charades.

speaker: Martin
text: Ready?  All right, go!

speaker: Daphne
text: Three words.

speaker: Daphne
text: Morning.

speaker: Noel
text: Morning Becomes Electra!

speaker: Roz
text: Yes!

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Four seconds? _Everyone on Roz's side of the room throws up their hands and does a victory dance._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, well done Roz!  Nice playing with you, I'm out of here.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, wait a minute.  You've got to take a turn.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, really?

speaker: Roz
text: You've got thirty seconds to prepare.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.  Maybe I'll just...prepare in the kitchen! [_He rushes to the kitchen and dials his cell phone._] Tricia!  You know, you're going to laugh when you hear this.  Hello?  Tricia?  Oh, fine. [_He reads the slip of paper._] Ha, ha, "The Iceman Cometh"!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming out of the kitchen_] All right.

speaker: Roz
text: Ready?  OK, go. [_Frasier begins gesturing._]

speaker: Martin
text: Three words.  First word, small word, arm, in, of, to, be.

speaker: Bulldog
text: It, it, I, you, me.

speaker: Martin
text: They, them, us, we, he, she.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ok, forget about it.  Second word, two syllables.  First syllable cold, chilly, freezing, winter,.

speaker: Martin
text: Snow, sleet hail, frost, frostbite, gangrene.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gangrene?!

speaker: Roz
text: No talking allowed.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Second syllable.  Shrink.  Doctor.  Dork.

speaker: Martin
text: Person, guy, male, man.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Let's see, icy cold man...iceman...got it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Frosty the Snowman!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you jackass!  The Iceman Cometh!

speaker: Roz
text: Disqualified.

speaker: Frasier
text: You two are the worst charades players I've ever seen in my entire life!  My God, those skating chimps could... Well, you did your best, we'll get it next time.  Off I go...

speaker: Roz
text: No, wait, wait, wait Frasier, we still have one little consolation prize for you.

speaker: All
text: Happy Birthday to you, happy birthday to you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, he's crying!

speaker: All
text: Happy birthday dear Frasier, happy birthday to you.   **...AND MILES TO GO BEFORE I SCREAM** _Scene 3 - In Front of Tricia's Apartment Fade in.  Tricia is coming out of the door with her bag. Frasier pulls up in his car._

speaker: Frasier
text: Made it!

speaker: Tricia
text: Boy, are you wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Tricia, please...

speaker: Tricia
text: Save it, Frasier.  I have a plane leaving for Spokane in An hour, my cab is on its way, so why don't you just be on your way, too?

speaker: Frasier
text: Would it make any difference if I told you I had to sneak out of a birthday party being given for me by my own father just to be here with you?

speaker: Tricia
text: Yeah, right.  It's your birthday.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling out his license_] Look, if you don't believe me, here, just see for yourself.  In fact, it's turning out to be the worst birthday party I've had since I was eight, when I pinned the tail on Sally Anunsiato.  She shoved a cupcake down my shorts.

speaker: Tricia
text: Wow, you really blew off your own birthday party just to come meet me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I would have done almost anything to get to know you better.

speaker: Tricia
text: Well, that's very sweet, Frasier, and I wish I had more time, but I have an 8 AM appointment in Spokane, and I can't miss my plane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I could drive you.

speaker: Tricia
text: But it's only twenty minutes to the airport, it's hardly worth it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wasn't talking about the airport.

speaker: Tricia
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I could have you in Spokane in six hours.  That'll certainly give us enough time to get acquainted.

speaker: Tricia
text: Oh, no, I can't ask you to do that.

speaker: Frasier
text: But you didn't ask.  I offered.  Look, I want to do it, here. [_He grabs her bag and puts it in his car._]

speaker: Tricia
text: That's the most romantic thing I've ever heard.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening the door for her_] Well, the way I see it, one of two things can happen.  Either we'll discover that we've foolishly built each other up in our own imaginations because we've had so much trouble getting together; or, this could end up being a story we tell our grandchildren. Personally, I can't wait to find out which.

speaker: Tricia
text: Me either. [_She gets in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_running around to his side_] Oh, boy! [_He gets in._] Well, off we go. _DISSOLVE TO: the interior of the car as they head down the road. Tricia turns on the radio._

speaker: Tricia
text: I thought I'd find us a little background music.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good idea.  Looking for some more opera?

speaker: Tricia
text: Heck, no.  The one the other night was my first and last. I was dragged to it by one of my converts. [_She stops on a country-western station._] There we go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Converts, you say?

speaker: Tricia
text: Mm-hmm.  I'm one of the Truth bringers.  I was ordained by Brother Carmichael himself, the evangelist?  I go door to door, spreading his word.  Listen, do you mind my asking something?  Have you heard the Truth?

speaker: Frasier
text: Something tells me I'm about to.  _CUT TO: the road, Frasier's car heading away to the strains of country music.  FADE OUT._
